titleStmt.title: A Magyar Országgyűlés Korpusza ParlaMint-HU [ParlaMint.ana]
Hungarian parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-HU [ParlaMint.ana]
A Magyar Országgyűlés ülései, 7., 8. és 9. ciklus (2014 - 2022)
Minutes of the National Assembly of Hungary, Term 7, 8 and 9 (2014 - 2022)

respStmt.resp: A ParlaMint TEI XML formátum előállítása

availability.p: Ez a munka az alábbi licensz alapján használható: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License
This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License

bibl.title: A Magyar Országgyűlés ülései
Minutes of the National Assembly of Hungary

projectDesc.p: A ParlaMint projekt célja, hogy (1) többnyelvű, egységes kódolású, összehasonlítható korpuszokat hozzon létre a parlamenti eljárások szövegeiből (2) ezen korpuszokat nyelvileg feldolgozza; (3) a korpuszokat letölthetővé és konkordancia-lekérdezőkön keresztül elérhetővé tegye; és ezáltal (4) a politikatudományok és a digitális bölcsészet területén felhasználható eseteket hozzon létre.

The ParlaMint project aims to (1) create a multilingual set of uniformly encoded comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings (2) process the corpora linguistically; (3) make the corpora available for download and through concordancers; and (4) build use cases in PoliticalSciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

correction.p: No correction of source texts was performed.

normalization.p: Text has not been normalised, except for speakers' name and affiliation.

hyphenation.p: No end-of-line hyphens were present in the source.

quotation.p: Quotation marks have been left in the text and are not explicitly marked up.

segmentation.p: The texts are segmented into utterances (speeches) and segments (corresponding to paragraphs in the source transcription).

category.catDesc: Képviselő : parlamenti képviselő, az ülés rendes felszólalója
Regular : a regular speaker at a sitting
Guest : a guest speaker at a sitting
Legislative period : term of the parliament between general elections.

Legislative session : the period of time in which a legislatureis convened for purpose of lawmaking, usually being one of two or more smaller divisions of the entire time between two elections. A session is a meeting or series of connected meetings devoted to a single order of business, program, agenda, or announced purpose.
Meeting : Each meeting may be a separate session or part of a group of meetings constituting a session. The session/meeting may take one or more days.
acl : Clausal modifier of noun (adjectival clause)
advmod_locy : Language-specific subtype of advmod, locative adverbial modifier
advmod_mode : Language-specific subtype of advmod, modal adverbial modifier
advmod_que : Language-specific subtype of advmod, question suffix
advmod_tform : Language-specific subtype of advmod, adverbial modifier from when
advmod_tlocy : Language-specific subtype of advmod, adverbial modifier when
advmod_to : Language-specific subtype of advmod, adverbial modifier where to
advmod_tto : Language-specific subtype of advmod, adverbial modifier till when
amod_att : Language-specific subtype of amod, attributive adjectival modifier
amod_attlvc : Language-specific subtype of amod, participle in a light-verb construction
ccomp_obj : Language-specific subtype of ccomp, object clausal complement
ccomp_obl : Language-specific subtype of ccomp, clausal complement (non-object)
ccomp_pred : Language-specific subtype of ccomp, clausal complement (predicative)
compound_preverb : Language-specific subtype of compound, preverbal modifier
flat_name : Specialisation of flat used for names
nmod_attlvc : Object nominal in a nominalized light-verb construction
nsubj_lvc : Subject in a light-verb construction
obj_lvc : Object in a light-verb construction

prefixDef.p: Private URIs with this prefix point to elements giving their name. In this document they are simply local references into the UD-SYN taxonomy categories in the corpus root TEI header.

application.label: HuSpaCy
application.desc: HuSpaCy is a spaCy library providing industrial-strength Hungarian language processing facilities through spaCy models. The released pipelines consist of a tokenizer, sentence splitter, lemmatizer, tagger (predicting morphological features as well), dependency parser and a named entity recognition module. It is available from https://github.com/huspacy/huspacy .
